It is the work developed by Jorge Mestre and is located on the bank of river Guatapuri on a rock by reference to this legendary silhouette of this legend. It is one of the most important resorts in the region, it is formed in one of the wells Guatapuri river; born in the lagoon of Curigua, in the Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta and is acorazonado by predominant rocks. The Guatapurí River It is the quintessential spa vallenato. When you go, do not stop eating sausage, bun and typical foods of the region.".
Since 2004 the Vallenato Festival takes place, is an ecological, cultural and tourist site, has a capacity of seventeen thousand people.
This sculpture is at the entrance of Valledupar since 1994, arriving by way of Barranquilla and foundation, it is a tribute to life.

In 2010, the municipality of Valledupar has a population, according to official projections of the DANE, the Municipality. Population growth has been explosive since the mid-twentieth century, with maximum growth rates in the 1960s and 1970s; today although population growth rates have been declining population still continues to grow rapidly due to immigration an increase of urban population to the detriment of the rural.
Of the total population, 52.1porciento are women, 12.2 percent calls itself raizal, black, palenquero, black, or African American. The 88.3porciento of over 5 years literate, the enrollment rate between 5 and 18 years of age is 80 percent. 61.8 percent is high school, 19.4 percent studied a career either normalista,
46.2 percent of those over 16 are unmarried, 25.9 live in free union and 17.6 percent are married, and 5 percent are separated or divorced. 30 percent of the population of Valledupar was born in another municipality, and 0.2 percent in another country. Valledupar population grows at an annual rate of 1.32 percent, one of the highest nationwide.
